metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5259 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the CanonicalizeXPCOMParticipant function in Mozilla Firefox before 48.0 and Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a script that closes its own Service Worker within a nested sync event loop.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5259` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
